moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Qxd5 3. Nc3 Qe5+ 4. Qe2: It has to be proven that the queen's exchange is the best for black.
moves.5. Bxe2 c6: This is necessary, since the white knight can jump and threathen Nc2+.
moves.6. Bc4: A loss of time, while white could have kept the development with Nf3 or d4.
moves.6... Bf5 7. d3 Nd7 8. Nf3 O-O-O: My king in this side is going to be attacked, but normally black survives.
moves.10. Nd4 Bg6: Fatal mistake, that gives up a most important square.
moves.12... Ne5: Not a wise choice (better was Nb3, maybe). I thought that it was better to sac a pawn, but I was very wrong.
moves.13. Bxe5 fxe5 14. Rfe1: I cannot defend the pawn. Let's see if I can untangle myself.
moves.14... b5 15. Bb3 b4 16. Na4: Now white has a huge penetration on my undefended king.
moves.18. Rae1 Ng4: POintless, I just tried to open a little my pieces.
moves.19. Ra5 Kb8: Now I couldn't see a mate for white, even if the position calls for that.
moves.21. Bc4 g6 22. h3 Bh6: NxB is not possible anymore, but...
moves.23. g4: threatening g5, and Bd2 is too dangerous (Rd1).
moves.24. f4: Still threatening. gxf, g5! and I lose a piece.
moves.24... Rhg8 25. fxg5 Bxg5 26. Nxg5: I realized that I had to exchange the bishop first, but I didn't realize that...
moves.26... Bxc4: ...I cannot take the knight because of Na3+, winning the exchange (RxR, KxN).
moves.27. dxc4 h5: well, let's try to grab the only advantage I have
moves.28. Re5 hxg4 29. Kh2 Rgh8: Now I threaten gxh and Ng5+ forking the rook.
moves.30. Na6+ Kb7 31. Ne6: White apparently doesn't see it... or has he a mate?
moves.31... gxh3 32. Nec5+ Kb6: It's incredible. With all those white pieces around my king, and no mate is coming.
moves.34. Kg3 Nxe5 35. Rxb4+ Ka5 36. Ra4+ Kb6: White, despite his pieces, cannot find a way to materialize his position, and his pieces are not useful.
moves.38. Kf2 h2 39. c5+ Kb5: Or Kb7, but I was tempting the fate again.
moves.40. Ra3: I think white could have played here b3, winning.
moves.40... h1=N+: I didn't want surprises, so I promoted with check. Maybe a mistake, but I was far too lucky to risk again.
moves.41. Kf1 Ng3+ 42. Kf2 Rh2+ 43. Ke3 Nc4+: And my opponent felt he had no chances anymore. Well played in the opening for white, for sure!
